definition: to avoid evil spirits
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal
to avoid calamities and evil spirits

sentences.english: It is said to ward off evil spirits.
They hang a sheep's head in their drawing room, it is said to avoid evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 她們家客廳掛了一個羊頭，聽說可以避邪。

sentences.english: As Sessay's funeral, relatives have covered Sessay's face with ritualisticpowder to ward off evil.
sentences.chinese: 葬禮上，親屬們在塞薩伊的臉上覆上一層避邪的粉末。

sentences.english: The charm can ward off evil spirits.
Announcements, updates, is said to ward off evil spraying noon.
sentences.chinese: 說是午時噴灑雄黃酒是避邪。

sentences.english: Girls' Day is connected to an old custom that used dolls to get rid of evil.
sentences.chinese: 女兒節與一個利用人偶來避邪的古老習俗有關。

definition: to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
to drive out devils/exorcism
to drive out devils and spirits exorcism
to expel pestilences
wards off disease
evil spirit
mythical animal that brings luck and wards off evil, having head of a dragon and lion's body, often with hoofs, wings and tail/also written 辟邪/fig. valiant soldier
to avoid calamities
lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
to guard against evil/to exorcise
amulet/protective talisman/charm
to ward off calamities/to avoid disaster
to exorcise/to drive away evil spirits
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
to drive out devils/to exorcise
to seek luck and avoid calamity (idiom)
